alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Orleans and northeastern Franklin Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westfield, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jay, Jay In Franklin County, North Troy Village, Westfield, Richford, Lowell, Troy, Montgomery, North Troy and Stevens Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern and northwestern Vermont.
